question: Fredrich's ataxia is caused by which type of mutation-
exp: Ans. is 'b' i. e., Expanded trinucleotide repeat o Freidrich ataxia is an autosomal recessive disorder. o It is caused by loss of functional mutation in frataxin gene (FxN) gene. o Frataxin gene is located on chromosome 9ql 3. o Majority of patients have an expanded trinucleotide repeat in intron 1 of both alleles of frataxin gene.
